docs.snippet: The first semifinal games in the new college football playoff system will be played in the Rose Bowl and the Sugar Bowl on Jan. 1, 2015....
docs.lead_paragraph: The first semifinal games in the new college football playoff system will be played in the Rose Bowl and the Sugar Bowl on Jan. 1, 2015.
docs.abstract: First semifinal games in new college football playoff system will be played in Rose and Sugar bowls on Jan 1, 2015.

docs.snippet: ESPN play-by-play announcer Brent Musburger was criticized for comments he made about the girlfriend of Alabama quarterback A J McCarron....
docs.lead_paragraph: ESPN play-by-play announcer Brent Musburger was criticized for comments he made about the girlfriend of Alabama quarterback A J McCarron.
docs.abstract: ESPN play-by-play announcer Brent Musburger, who is known for controversial on-air remarks, has been widely criticized for comments he made about about Alabama quarterback A J McCarron's girlfriend Katherine Webb during national title game against Notre Dame.

headline.seo: Brent Musburger Criticized for Remarks About Miss Alabama
headline.main: Musburger Criticized for Remarks About Star’s Girlfriend During Title Game
headline.print_headline: Musburger Criticized for Remarks About Star’s Girlfriend During Title Game

docs.snippet: After a third national championship in four years, Alabama Coach Nick Saban was already getting antsy about next season, and impatient with questions about the N.F.L....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a third national championship in four years, Alabama Coach Nick Saban was already getting antsy about next season, and impatient with questions about the N.F.L.
docs.abstract: Alabama head football coach Nick Saban, who has collected four national championships, including three he has won with Alabama in past four seasons, is already getting antsy about next season, and impatient with questions about the NFL.

headline.seo: The Saban Way: Already Moving On
headline.main: The Saban Way: That Was Nice, Now Move On
headline.print_headline: The Saban Way: That Was Nice, Now Move On

byline.contributor: Tim Rohan contributed reporting from Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

docs.snippet: Alabama’s 42-14 win over Notre Dame in the B.C.S. national championship game Monday night was seen by an average of 26.4 million viewers, the second-biggest audience for a program in cable TV history....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alabama’s 42-14 win over Notre Dame in the B.C.S. national championship game Monday night was seen by an average of 26.4 million viewers, the second-biggest audience for a program in cable TV history.

headline.main: Crossing the Line Online: Sexual Harassment and Violence in the Age of Social Media

byline.original: By KATHERINE SCHULTEN and JENNIFER CUTRARO

docs.lead_paragraph: No one at PBS guessed that the opening episode of Season 3 of “Downton Abbey” would surpass the viewer numbers for some networks.
docs.abstract: Opening episode of Season 3 of PBS' British period drama Downton Abbey attracts at least 7.9 million viewers, surpassing viewer numbers of some commercial broadcasters that night.
